alert.note: Alert for Champaign; Clark (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 6:27AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CHAMPAIGN AND NORTHERN CLARK COUNTIES THROUGH 700 AM EDT... At 627 AM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located from 7 miles north of St. Paris to near North Lewisburg, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Urbana, St. Paris, Mechanicsburg, North Lewisburg, Brighton, Christiansburg, North Hampton, South Vienna, Tremont City, Woodstock, Catawba, Mutual, Cable, Thackery, Westville, Powhattan, Kiser Lake State Park, Millerstown and Catawba Station. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 64 and 70. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
